result.markdown:
---
title: ""
---




## Pacotes utilizados


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_1d342da526af35fba4399979b6a8c4d7'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(emmeans)
library(report)
library(MASS)
library(agricolae)
library(see)
library(estimability)
library(car)
```
:::


## Inferencial

## Teste T

### Dois grupos independentes


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_66d046539744400f6d2f679a809646e3'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(gsheet)
mg <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=983033137")
```
:::


#### Visualização


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_236339da3ed398805f348c112aa1f4bc'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)

mg |> 
  ggplot(aes(trat, comp))+
  geom_boxplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


##### Teste T - `t.test`


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_5d8c81a3dba6190ce3c18d72da201c07'}

```{.r .cell-code}
mg2 <- mg |> 
  tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = trat,
              values_from = comp)

teste1 <- t.test(mg2$control, mg2$Mg2)
```
:::


#### Teste de normalidade


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_b88e5ea0775ca2c7abbb720342ecbe58'}

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(mg2$control)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  mg2$control
W = 0.93886, p-value = 0.5404
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(mg2$control)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(mg2$Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  mg2$Mg2
W = 0.97269, p-value = 0.9146
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(mg2$Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Outra forma de verificar a normalidade:


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_cbed6b06a1e5d82c80bb94b2a231d0c7'}

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(mg2$control)
qqline(mg2$control)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


#### Teste de variância


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_5c1020b7cc7c337083b3e1899692fa5c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
var.test(mg2$control, mg2$Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	F test to compare two variances

data:  mg2$control and mg2$Mg2
F = 0.67654, num df = 9, denom df = 9, p-value = 0.5698
alternative hypothesis: true ratio of variances is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.1680428 2.7237436
sample estimates:
ratio of variances 
         0.6765394 
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_7b585a50a6352979469608fe05be2baf'}

```{.r .cell-code}
t.test(mg2$control, mg2$Mg2,
       var.equal = FALSE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Welch Two Sample t-test

data:  mg2$control and mg2$Mg2
t = 8.1549, df = 17.354, p-value = 2.423e-07
alternative hypothesis: true difference in means is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 3.825607 6.490393
sample estimates:
mean of x mean of y 
   15.678    10.520 
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_3a4e9958aef79df9737e3832ca32ed59'}

```{.r .cell-code}
report(teste1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Effect sizes were labelled following Cohen's (1988) recommendations.

The Welch Two Sample t-test testing the difference between mg2$control and
mg2$Mg2 (mean of x = 15.68, mean of y = 10.52) suggests that the effect is
positive, statistically significant, and large (difference = 5.16, 95% CI
[3.83, 6.49], t(17.35) = 8.15, p < .001; Cohen's d = 3.65, 95% CI [2.14, 5.12])
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-10_70a94b7494278aa708dfc969e63410f7'}

```{.r .cell-code}
micelial <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=959387827")

micelial |> 
  ggplot(aes(especie, tcm))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.01)+
  stat_summary(
    geom = "point",
    fun.y = "mean",
    size = 3,
    color = "red"
  )
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


#### Teste Anova

Obs: dados modificados anteriormente.


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-11_21077a30dccd5a33dc8fdb4c059e788b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
m1 <- lm(tcm ~especie, data = micelial)

anova(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: tcm
          Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
especie    4 1.46958 0.36739  19.629 2.028e-07 ***
Residuals 25 0.46792 0.01872                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(m1) 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-0.23667 -0.09667  0.01583  0.08833  0.28333 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  1.57167    0.05585  28.140  < 2e-16 ***
especieFaus -0.33500    0.07899  -4.241 0.000266 ***
especieFcor -0.25000    0.07899  -3.165 0.004047 ** 
especieFgra -0.66000    0.07899  -8.356 1.05e-08 ***
especieFmer -0.14500    0.07899  -1.836 0.078317 .  
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.1368 on 25 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.7585,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.7199 
F-statistic: 19.63 on 4 and 25 DF,  p-value: 2.028e-07
```
:::
:::


#### Verificar a diferença entre as médias

Utiliza-se o pacote emmeans


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-12_28879d22618002398e968c6523a9ccff'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(emmeans)

medias1 <- emmeans(m1, ~especie)

library(multcomp)
library(multcompView) 
cld(medias1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 especie emmean     SE df lower.CL upper.CL .group
 Fgra     0.912 0.0559 25    0.797     1.03  1    
 Faus     1.237 0.0559 25    1.122     1.35   2   
 Fcor     1.322 0.0559 25    1.207     1.44   2   
 Fmer     1.427 0.0559 25    1.312     1.54   23  
 Fasi     1.572 0.0559 25    1.457     1.69    3  

Confidence level used: 0.95 
P value adjustment: tukey method for comparing a family of 5 estimates 
significance level used: alpha = 0.05 
NOTE: If two or more means share the same grouping symbol,
      then we cannot show them to be different.
      But we also did not show them to be the same. 
```
:::
:::


#### Verificando as Premissas


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-13_1cbf0907b3d270bfa9fe8314b288837c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Testar normalidade:
hist(m1$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(m1$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  m1$residuals
W = 0.9821, p-value = 0.8782
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Variâncias:
bartlett.test(tcm ~especie, data = micelial)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Bartlett test of homogeneity of variances

data:  tcm by especie
Bartlett's K-squared = 4.4367, df = 4, p-value = 0.3501
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(DHARMa)
plot(simulateResiduals(m1))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(performance)
check_normality(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.878).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(m1) 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.880).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_model(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-3.png){width=672}
:::
:::


#### Outro conjunto de dados onde as premissas não foram atendidas:

#### Importação dos dados


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-14_9880021f6d24277783b2c303f98ee4d0'}

```{.r .cell-code}
inseticida <- InsectSprays

inseticida |> 
  count(spray)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  spray  n
1     A 12
2     B 12
3     C 12
4     D 12
5     E 12
6     F 12
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
inseticida |> 
  ggplot(aes(spray, count))+
  geom_boxplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-15_26e5fd105e5efad7cdb7a96e1a3e60c8'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# lm = ajusta anova

m1 <- lm(count ~ spray,
         data = inseticida)

summary(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = count ~ spray, data = inseticida)

Residuals:
   Min     1Q Median     3Q    Max 
-8.333 -1.958 -0.500  1.667  9.333 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  14.5000     1.1322  12.807  < 2e-16 ***
sprayB        0.8333     1.6011   0.520    0.604    
sprayC      -12.4167     1.6011  -7.755 7.27e-11 ***
sprayD       -9.5833     1.6011  -5.985 9.82e-08 ***
sprayE      -11.0000     1.6011  -6.870 2.75e-09 ***
sprayF        2.1667     1.6011   1.353    0.181    
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 3.922 on 66 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.7244,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.7036 
F-statistic:  34.7 on 5 and 66 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: count
          Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
spray      5 2668.8  533.77  34.702 < 2.2e-16 ***
Residuals 66 1015.2   15.38                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(m1$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(m1$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  m1$residuals
W = 0.96006, p-value = 0.02226
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(m1$residuals)
qqline(m1$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
bartlett.test(count ~ spray,
             data = inseticida)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Bartlett test of homogeneity of variances

data:  count by spray
Bartlett's K-squared = 25.96, df = 5, p-value = 9.085e-05
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-16_d01db61e710c554225064e169dc6cbdf'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(performance)
check_normality(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Non-normality of residuals detected (p = 0.022).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Warning: Heteroscedasticity (non-constant error variance) detected (p < .001).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(DHARMa)
plot(simulateResiduals(m1))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


#### 1- Fazer a transformação dos dados

Função `sqrt` faz a raiz quadrada.


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-17_355e11e5ff91ee5c9281f7673cc964af'}

```{.r .cell-code}
inseticida <- inseticida |> 
  mutate(count2 = sqrt(count))

inseticida |> 
  ggplot(aes(spray, count2))+
  geom_boxplot()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-18_f0fddcd4a32ba4b0210895bf3f763803'}

```{.r .cell-code}
m2 <- lm(count2 ~ spray,
         data = inseticida)

summary(m2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = count2 ~ spray, data = inseticida)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-1.24486 -0.39970 -0.01902  0.42661  1.40089 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)   3.7607     0.1814  20.733  < 2e-16 ***
sprayB        0.1160     0.2565   0.452    0.653    
sprayC       -2.5158     0.2565  -9.807 1.64e-14 ***
sprayD       -1.5963     0.2565  -6.223 3.80e-08 ***
sprayE       -1.9512     0.2565  -7.606 1.34e-10 ***
sprayF        0.2579     0.2565   1.006    0.318    
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.6283 on 66 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.7724,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.7552 
F-statistic:  44.8 on 5 and 66 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova(m2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: count2
          Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
spray      5 88.438 17.6876  44.799 < 2.2e-16 ***
Residuals 66 26.058  0.3948                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(m2$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(m2$residuals)  
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  m2$residuals
W = 0.98721, p-value = 0.6814
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(m2$residuals)
qqline(m2$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
bartlett.test(count2 ~spray,
             data = inseticida)  
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Bartlett test of homogeneity of variances

data:  count2 by spray
Bartlett's K-squared = 3.7525, df = 5, p-value = 0.5856
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-19_361c2f376466ab4fb723b074dc40fbc3'}

```{.r .cell-code}
check_normality(m2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: residuals appear as normally distributed (p = 0.681).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
check_heteroscedasticity(m2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
OK: Error variance appears to be homoscedastic (p = 0.854).
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(simulateResiduals(m2)) #melhorou ainda mais a normmalidade e variância deu ñ significativo
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-20_c35277897b3a4573fdc9707bf8fc3a02'}

```{.r .cell-code}
m1_medias <- emmeans(m1, ~ spray,)
plot(m1_medias)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
cld(m1_medias)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

```
:::




#### Outra forma de transformação:


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-21_d1ddb29927c5ab273fbea243bc097b32'}

```{.r .cell-code}
b <- boxcox(lm(inseticida$count+0.1 ~1))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
lambda <- b$x[which.max(b$y)]

inseticida$count3 <- (inseticida$count ^ lambda - 1) / lambda

m5 <- lm(count3 ~ spray,
         data = inseticida)

summary(m5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = count3 ~ spray, data = inseticida)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-2.74114 -0.65893 -0.01922  0.78560  2.64047 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)   4.8835     0.3232  15.109  < 2e-16 ***
sprayB        0.1910     0.4571   0.418    0.677    
sprayC       -4.4995     0.4571  -9.843 1.42e-14 ***
sprayD       -2.7157     0.4571  -5.941 1.17e-07 ***
sprayE       -3.3605     0.4571  -7.352 3.82e-10 ***
sprayF        0.4162     0.4571   0.911    0.366    
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 1.12 on 66 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.7659,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.7482 
F-statistic: 43.19 on 5 and 66 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova(m5)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: count3
          Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
spray      5 270.737  54.147  43.191 < 2.2e-16 ***
Residuals 66  82.742   1.254                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(m5$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(m5$residuals)  
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  m5$residuals
W = 0.98873, p-value = 0.7723
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(m5$residuals)
qqline(m5$residuals)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
bartlett.test(count3 ~spray,
             data = inseticida)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Bartlett test of homogeneity of variances

data:  count3 by spray
Bartlett's K-squared = 5.7412, df = 5, p-value = 0.3322
```
:::
:::


#### 2- teste não paramétrico:


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-22_f87869e81d376ba1ec4168af3ed3ea94'}

```{.r .cell-code}
kruskal.test(count ~spray,
             data = inseticida) 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Kruskal-Wallis rank sum test

data:  count by spray
Kruskal-Wallis chi-squared = 54.691, df = 5, p-value = 1.511e-10
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
m3 <- kruskal(inseticida$count,
        inseticida$spray,
        group = TRUE)
```
:::


#### 3- GLMs


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-23_1081ab94f61479f41a0202e7de3c2f10'}

```{.r .cell-code}
m4 <- glm(count ~ spray,
          family = gaussian,
          data = inseticida)


m4 <- glm(count ~ spray,
          family = poisson,
          data = inseticida)
summary(m4)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
glm(formula = count ~ spray, family = poisson, data = inseticida)

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
(Intercept)  2.67415    0.07581  35.274  < 2e-16 ***
sprayB       0.05588    0.10574   0.528    0.597    
sprayC      -1.94018    0.21389  -9.071  < 2e-16 ***
sprayD      -1.08152    0.15065  -7.179 7.03e-13 ***
sprayE      -1.42139    0.17192  -8.268  < 2e-16 ***
sprayF       0.13926    0.10367   1.343    0.179    
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

(Dispersion parameter for poisson family taken to be 1)

    Null deviance: 409.041  on 71  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance:  98.329  on 66  degrees of freedom
AIC: 376.59

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 5
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova(m4)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Deviance Table

Model: poisson, link: log

Response: count

Terms added sequentially (first to last)

      Df Deviance Resid. Df Resid. Dev
NULL                     71     409.04
spray  5   310.71        66      98.33
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
Anova(m4)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Deviance Table (Type II tests)

Response: count
      LR Chisq Df Pr(>Chisq)    
spray   310.71  5  < 2.2e-16 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
plot(simulateResiduals(m4))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
m4_medias <- emmeans(m4, ~spray,
                     type = "response")

cld(m4_medias)
```

## Anova 2 fatores

## Importa os dados


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-24_f9e942977848d5f4a29e8470a3814847'}

```{.r .cell-code}
theme_set(theme_bw())
li <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=2023059672")


li |> 
  ggplot(aes(factor(dose), severity, color = factor(dose)))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.05)+
  facet_wrap(~~treat)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
li |> 
  ggplot(aes(factor(treat), severity, color = factor(dose)))+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.05)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](testet_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-2.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Anova


::: {.cell hash='testet_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-25_27894df8a765ae9b2638956c069f817e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
mf <- lm(severity ~treat*factor(dose),
         data = li)

anova(mf)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: severity
                   Df   Sum Sq  Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
treat               1 0.113232 0.113232  30.358 4.754e-05 ***
factor(dose)        1 0.073683 0.073683  19.755 0.0004077 ***
treat:factor(dose)  1 0.072739 0.072739  19.502 0.0004326 ***
Residuals          16 0.059678 0.003730                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::

### Comparar colunas

```{.r .cell-code}
cld(mf_medias)
```

```
      then we cannot show them to be different.
```
